bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, March 1, 1900

div1.p: Lazear provides his impressions of Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, March 1, 1900
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
Columbia Barracks
Havana Cuba
March 1, 1900
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
I received your letter telling
of the starting of the boxes. I have not
yet heard from them but will probably
hear in a day or so I am a thousand
times obliged to you for attending to them.
You must let me know what they
cost you. Everything goes on about
the same here. I am going out this
afternoon to try to find milk for Houston
I have heard of a good place kept
by an American. He seems satisfied
with the condensed milk but he
is not quite as fat as he was
and he is more restless at
night. The weather has been cool
for here about 60°, and there have
been rains and high winds.

We had a delightful drive a day or so
ago into the country. The country is very
beautiful and fertile and with good
government this should be a very rich
island. I shall write again in a day
or two.
